So powerful.. this is amazing. Nothing has changed, though, has it? Since the 2nd world war... innocent civilians are still dying in many parts of the world in the name of "peace" by cold-blooded leaders and soldiers thinking they're doing their people a favor.. protecting them from something.. but no one knows what this something is.
I love this song and I love this story. It shows that we take what we have for granted. I could not imagine living this way. Sad story but it makes you open your eyes and your ears to the world.

I remember hearing about this nasty period of American history from some elderly folk who lost everything when the Feds depopulated Bainbridge Island. And it makes me #$$#^ sick when people start advocating a repeat of this garbage with "Muslims" and "Commies"

I love this song, I cry every time I hear the woman on it speak, because she sounds so much like my grandmother, who is also Japanese-American. 
But to Sam_Paine, and everyone else who comments on the Japanese atrocities during World War II as a sick sort of justification for internment, you are missing the point. 
Internment was not hurtful to these people because they were Japanese, it hurt because they were American.

I have shivers from this song. all of our rights is the government's lies and history proves this...
